page.title: 01MERTON AND HUISH_OUR BLOCK
page.content:
Our 4Km./3Km.block includes most of two very rural parishes {Merton},in the north and {Huish},in the south.It also includes a small part of{Dolton}.
{Merton},the principal village,lies astride the A 386 road midway between the towns of Torrington and Hatherleigh.This busy highway,one of the main routes linking North Devon and the city of Plymouth,runs from north to south through the west of our block.
The river Mere,from which{Merton} derives its name,crosses our block from south-west to north-east to join the{Torridge},one of Devon's principal rivers.Flowing from south to north in its deeply incised and thickly wooded valley the{Torridge }forms a boundary between{Merton}and{Dolton}in the east.
